definition: to draw the outline of/to outline/to sketch/to delineate contours of/to give a brief account of
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux

sentences.english: Sibal also outlined a 10-point innovation strategy.
sentences.chinese: Sibal還勾勒出了一個10點創新戰略。

sentences.english: In the boundless twilight, this herd of beautiful creatures are silhouetted by the rays of evening sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 暮色蒼茫中，這一羣美生靈被霞光勾勒出一片剪影。

sentences.english: How about a skillfully cut sundress that showcases your beautiful bosom and neck?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣才能巧妙地勾勒出胸部和頸部的完美線條呢？

sentences.english: The natural landscape outlined Duplication aristocratic life.
sentences.chinese: 自然景觀勾勒貴族生活摹本。

sentences.english: First the paper outlined the appearance the folklore culture existing in Jialing' s Ci.
sentences.chinese: 第一章勾勒了民俗文化在迦陵詞中存在的狀態。

sentences.english: This is another of the great pictures Isaiah has given us of Jesus Christ.
sentences.chinese: 這是以賽亞爲耶穌基督勾勒的另一幅重要寫照。

sentences.english: Let's pause to figure out what we want to develop.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們暫停一下來勾勒所需開發的應用程序。

sentences.english: If you’re a painter, start the broad strokes on the canvas.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是一個畫家，開始在畫布上盡情勾勒吧。

sentences.english: At the series of meetings in Cairo, Roosevelt outlined his vision for postwar Asia.
sentences.chinese: 開羅之系列會議中，羅斯福爲戰後之亞洲勾勒願景。

sentences.english: A ray of sunshine, outline for you my all memory.
sentences.chinese: 羾一縷陽光，勾勒出我對你所有的記憶。

sentences.english: The size of the shift is called the redshift, and it helps scientists figure out the movement of stars in space. Hydra isn’t the only distant cluster of galaxies that displays a redshift, though.
sentences.chinese: “紅移”有助於科學家勾勒出星球在空間的運動狀態。

sentences.english: Circumferential liposuction to help you outline the lady slim curve.
sentences.chinese: 環周吸脂幫你勾勒淑女苗條曲線。

sentences.english: Sketch the trees and the daffodils.
sentences.chinese: 樹木和黃水仙色的勾勒。

sentences.english: The teacher delineated China on the blackboard with a coloured chalk.
sentences.chinese: 老師用彩色粉筆在黑板上勾勒出中國的邊界。

sentences.english: I loved the way the lights shone through the fog and silhouetted the people as they walked.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡這種光線穿過霧靄勾勒出行人輪廓的畫面。

sentences.english: Be in charge of paint, in a thin biscuit sketched by pure love.
sentences.chinese: 執管揮毫，在薄薄的素坯上勾勒出潔白無暇的愛情。

definition: line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
to delineate/to articulate/to evoke/to draw out/to tick off
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
